intro: Astronidium ligulatum, commonly known as the narrow-leafed starling tree, is a flowering plant native to the rainforests of Queensland, Australia. It is a small to medium-sized evergreen tree that typically grows to a height of 8–15 meters. The plant is characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves and clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers. It produces small, round, yellowish fruits that are edible for some bird species. Astronidium ligulatum plays an important ecological role in its native habitat, providing food and shelter for various wildlife.
